sentences.english: Yet it is one America should take, given the steep road ahead.
sentences.chinese: 然而，考慮到未來路途險阻，這正是美國應作的抉擇。

sentences.english: Passing beyond narrow defiles, to pursue the enemy some distance, this is terrain which will exhaust the chariots.
sentences.chinese: 越險阻，長途追逐敵人，這就是戰車的竭地。

sentences.english: An ass lade with gold overtake every thing.
They think little of the difficulties and setbacks on their way forward.
sentences.chinese: 他們對前進道路上的艱難險阻視若等閒。

sentences.english: And walk through this bumpiness road, in the solemn song of sorrow.
sentences.chinese: 在這悲壯歌聲中，走過這崎嶇險阻的道路。

sentences.english: They encountered untold difficulties and dangers before they reached their destination.
sentences.chinese: 他們經歷過數不盡的艱難險阻纔到達目的地。

sentences.english: Whatever happened, we work high above the ground like a spider.
sentences.chinese: 無論高難險阻，我們的高空作業“蜘蛛人”一馬平川。

sentences.english: Many difficulties and dangers attended upon his single-handed voyage round the world.
sentences.chinese: 他單獨作環球旅行，遇到了許多艱難險阻。

sentences.english: Don't be a quitter at any time, even in face of immense difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 任何時候都不要輕易放棄，即使遇到了艱難險阻。

definition: lit. to cut one's way through thistles and thorns (idiom)/fig. to overcome all obstacles on the way/to break through hardships/to blaze a new trail
to thwart/to foil (sb's plans)/a setback/a failure/a defeat
tossed about by the wind and rain (idiom)/(of a situation) unstable
stumbling block/obstacle/someone who gets in your way
